definition: love at first sight
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: People fall in love with the circled golden woollen carpet AT first sight because of its unique design.
sentences.chinese: 盘金羊毛地毯以其独特的设计让人一见倾心。

sentences.english: Henry and Jeanne take a shine to each other.
sentences.chinese: 亨利和珍妮彼此一见倾心。

sentences.english: Don't underestimate love at first sight.
I was already developing a crush on her.
Without being an exception, Shen was also totally attracted by her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 毫无例外地，她的美丽，也让沈从文一见倾心。

sentences.english: It was at first sight, as the novels say.
sentences.chinese: 正如小说中所说的，那是一见倾心。

sentences.english: Julius Caesar was ravished by Cleopatra's beauty.
sentences.chinese: 克娄巴特拉的美貌使恺撒一见倾心。

sentences.english: Hennry and Jenny took a shine to each other .
sentences.chinese: 亨利和珍妮彼此一见倾心。

sentences.english: Maggie: You mean love at first sight?
sentences.chinese: 你信任一见倾心的爱情吗？

sentences.english: After east wind of week of elegant come across of female actor article, also see admire, pursuit of do all one can.
sentences.chinese: 女艺人文雅偶遇周东风后，也一见倾心，奋力追求。

sentences.english: Love it at sight, never tireless, deserve to own.
sentences.chinese: 一见倾心，百看不厌，值得拥有。

sentences.english: Helly and Jenny they take a shine to each other.
sentences.chinese: 亨利和珍妮彼此一见倾心。

sentences.english: To the word love at first sight.

definition: love at first sight (idiom)
to admire wholeheartedly/to fall in love with
deeply attached/devoted
to feel a rush of excitement (idiom)
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
to adore/to admire greatly
familiarity at first sight
to adore/to admire
to be moved/to be tempted
to meet by chance/to run into sb/chance encounter
to fall in love
heartbeat/heart rate/(fig.) emotionally affected/aroused (of desire, emotion, interest etc)
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
to be fascinated/to be captivated
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
